openconnector

Class ConnectorException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • openconnector.ConnectorException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationFailedException, ConnectionFailedException, InsufficientPermissionException, InvalidConfigurationException, InvalidRequestException, InvalidResponseException, ObjectAlreadyExistsException, ObjectNotFoundException

    public class ConnectorException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    A generic exception thrown by connectors when operations fail. This usually indicates some problem with the underlying resource or the data passed to the resource.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.String error,
                  java.lang.String suggestion,
                  java.lang.Throwable t)
        Create a new ConnectorException from an error text, suggestion text and existing exception.

        The error and suggestion being set here is used later to prepare well formatted exception message based on resource bundle key 'msg_with_suggestion' and 'msg_no_suggestion'. But all this happens lazily when openconnector exception gets converted to it's counterpart exception in sailpoint.connector.

        Parameters:
        error - ResourceBundle message key, or a plain text message containing error details.
        suggestion - ResourceBundle message key, or a plain text message containing hints to solve the error.
        t - Throwable object t can be provided at the time of calling following constructor.
